directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large saute pan on medium-high heat, heat olive oil; add onions and garlic; cook for 2 minutes. Add shrimp, tilapia and bay scallops; cook 3-4 minutes until about halfway done. Add Clamato(R), lemon juice, seafood seasoning, basil and rice; mix well. Cook to heat through.

Remove from heat; blend in Monterrey Jack. Spoon mixture into peppers, place in a lightly greased baking dish, cover with foil and bake for 20 minutes. Remove foil and top with Cheddar; bake 5 more minutes or until the cheese is melted.
ingredients: 1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled, deveined and diced
1 tilapia fillet, cut into bite-size pieces
4 cubanelle peppers, cut in half and hollowed out
title: Clamato® Seafood Stuffed Peppers
